Posts.Content: Apr 25, 2011 11:50PM paintedlady wrote: Thank you all so much for your input. For me, the most traumatic thing of getting chemo was losing my hair. Thanks for the suggestion of using generic rogaine. Think I will try it. After reading all your posts, I do feel better
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Apr 25, 2011 09:58AM paintedlady wrote: Hi Girls Been reading the discussions on hair growth .  Well, I had my last chemo treatment on Feb. 22.(Had 4 rounds of cytoxin and taxotere) Two months and 3 days later, I still have very little hair growth. My scalp is still quite bald. I am getting very worried.. Some other posts that I have read state that hair growth started in a month.Is this an indication that I may be bald?
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Oct 25, 2010 08:00AM paintedlady wrote: Hi Mooner I want to take this opportunity to encourage you to see a doctor and have a mammogram and ultrasound.  I dont mean to frighten you, but I had the same symptoms as you. My doctor thought I had mastitis until the ultrasound showed an abnormal finding. To make a long story short, a biopsy was done and I was diagnosed with cancer. I am not saying you have the disease, but as the old saying goes "It is better to be safe than sorry" Good luck to you
Posts.Title: I have a painful lump... mooner123 mooner123

Posts.Content: May 9, 2011 08:44PM paintedlady wrote: Hi Kelly So sorry to hear all this. I agree with all the other sisters that waiting is the worse part. Like you, I have no family history of this terrible disease. Yes, it is a shocker to be told on the phone that the biopsy is positive. You are not along here. I have posted when I have had problems or questions and these sisters helped me so much. They are so kind and caring. So, please don"t hesitate to tells us what is going on or if you need to vent. It will get better. Cyber hugs to you
